lists-iteration_key2: In a class, the teacher marks attendance by calling out their names one by one, from a list of students. This process is called Iteration.
lists-iteration_key3: ITERATE is a very important word, which you should bring in your vocabulary.
lists-iteration_key4: Repeat the same action with each element means iterate over the list. There could be many examples of Iteration like:
lists-iteration_key5: Iterate on your own contact list
lists-iteration_key6: one by one to all your friends
lists-iteration_key8: To iterate over the names of students list
lists-iteration_key9: See their report cards one by one
lists-iteration_key10: calculate their marks one by one
lists-iteration_key12: Now iterate over the names of your friends list
lists-iteration_key13: Giving tea one by one to your friends
lists-iteration_key14: Out of them, the friend sitting nearest to you
lists-iteration_key15: you give them biscuit together with tea.
lists-iteration_key16: Basically, the work that we do repeatedly is called as Iteration . Using loops, we have learned how to do iteration. But , we don't know how to iterate over a list. Now we will learn how to run loop on any list.

lists-iteration_key27: Here we have to check in the while loop that the value of the index should be less than the list_length. The loop will stop working at the moment when the index value will become equal to the list_length.
